subhead: Tyler Robinson, arrested on Thursday night, is a 22-year-old White man who grew up in a conservative family in Utah and was a brilliant high school student. Nothing in his background supports the theory being propagated in MAGA circles that he is a far-left activist.

Undercover but never unmasked: The untold story of a KGB spy in France
subhead: Following archival research and interviews with witnesses, Le Monde pieced together the completely unknown story of 'Lydia Tows,' a Russian agent who died in Paris in 1999. Working in tandem with a French police officer, she carried out a decades-long infiltration mission with devastating consequences.

title: Sushila Karki appointed as Nepal's prime minister with mission to preserve unity
subhead: Four days after violence left 51 people dead and devastated key seats of power, the former chief justice of the Supreme Court was appointed as interim prime minister. Parliament was dissolved.

title: The gentle power of dormant volcanoes in central France
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (6/6). Dormant for six thousand years, the majestic craters of Auvergne, their contours softened by erosion, remain under constant watch. Mathieu Richer Mamousse, a 36-year-old French photographer, traversed the ridges and pastures of the Massif Central's landscapes in July.

title: Dan Brown, author of 'The Secret of Secrets': Robert Langdon is 'the man I wish I could be'
subhead: The American author discusses his new novel, 'The Secret of Secrets,' and the relationship he has with books' recurring protagonist, Robert Langdon, some of whose esoteric beliefs he now seems to share.

When everyday hatred turns to racist murder: 'I don't know why I lost it. I have no idea'
subhead: On May 31, Christophe Belgembe, a mechanic, fatally shot his neighbor Hichem Miraoui and tried to kill five other people in the southern French town of Puget-sur-Argens. Though he had made racist remarks for years, he struggled to explain his actions.
byline: By Lorraine de Foucher  and Jérôme Lefilliâtre

title: France's 'Block Everything' protests converge around ousting Macron
subhead: Although France did not come to a standstill or grind to a halt on Wednesday, numerous protests took place throughout the day across the country with large gatherings in certain cities – with headcounts between 197,000 and 250,000 people – amid the firm presence of law enforcement.
byline: By Thibaud Métais (with Le Monde's correspondents and reporters)

title: A new exhibition brings the Paris suburbs from the outside to the forefront
subhead: The exhibit at the Museum of Immigration in Paris cleverly focuses on a few moments and places to address the many social, political and economic issues associated with these neglected areas.
